tit.cmt: ２行目に翻訳が入っていたので１行目に移しました。

sen.j: 一君万民論（いっくんばんみんろん）はただ一人の君主にのみ生来の権威・権限を認め、その他の臣下・人民の間には原則として一切の差別・身分差を認めないとする思想・主張である。
sen.e: Ikkunbanmin-ron is the thought that constitutional authority is given to only one ruler and any discrimination and distinction of social status are generally not allowed to his/her subjects or people

Ikkunbanmin-ron is a theory in which constitutional authority is given to only one ruler, and under this sovereignty any discrimination and distinction from social status shold not be allowed among all other people.
sen.cmt: ronをtheoryとし（論ですので）、以降、適宜、Ikkunbanmin-ron theoryのように使用しました。

sen.j: 明治政府は華族制度の創設や武士身分の士族への編入など、当初は旧来の身分制度をある程度継承したものの、廃藩置県・徴兵令・秩禄処分といった政策の強行は特権身分に対して大きな打撃を与えた。
sen.e: At first the Meiji Government continued the castle system to some extent establishing the peerage and transferring the samurai status to the warrior class, but politics including Haihan-chiken (abolition of feudal domains and establishment of prefectures), Conscription Ordinance and Chitsuroku-shobun (Abolition Measure of Hereditary Stipend) dealt a severe blow to the favored classes.

At first the Meiji Government kept the class system, introducing the peerage system by transferring the samurai class, the previous ruling class, into one of the classes of the new system as Shizoku (literally, the warrior class), but the major political changes the government took, including Haihan-chiken (abolition of feudal domain and establishment of prefectures), Conscription Ordinance and Chitsuroku-shobun (measures to abolish hereditary stipends) were significant blows to the privileged class.
sen.cmt: the castle system--> the class system表現を変更しました。

sen.j: その後も一君万民論は朝野における思想的底流として根強く、断続的に天皇の権威強化と皇室以外の身分特権の縮小がなされていった。
sen.e: As Ikkunbanmin-ron was rooted strongly as the ideological basement at court and among the citizens after that, the authority of the emperor was consolidated and the privileges of the favored classes other than Imperial family were reduced.

Meantime, as the Ikkunbanmin-ron theory was still robust as an undercurrent ideology at the court and among ordinary people, the authority of the emperor was consequently reinforced, and the privileges to the nobles other than the Imperial Family became gradually reduced.

sen.j: 士族制度は早い段階で形骸化し、貴族院 (日本)に依拠する少なからぬ特権を有した華族制度に対しても批判は少なくなかった。
sen.e: The warrior class become a mere façade early and there were not a few criticisms against the peerage which enjoyed a good deal of privilege depending on the House of Peers (Japan).
The warrior class turned out to be a mere shell in the early stage, and the peerage system, in which a good deal of privilege relating to the House of Peers was given, stirred up criticism.

sen.e: Some people from the peerage wondered about the privileged class system and gave up their peerage.

sen.j: 一君万民論は藩閥体制打倒とデモクラシー導入の大義として掲げられ、身分的特権のみならず財閥などの経済的権力に対抗するイデオロギーとしても機能した。
sen.e: Ikkunbanmin-ron was put up as a cause of toppling the domain clique system and introducing democracy, so it functioned as the ideology to oppose not only the privileges of the favored classes but also plutocracy such as Zaibatsu(a financial clique).

The Ikkunbanmin-ron theory was used as a great cause of toppling the domain clique system and introducing democracy, and it functioned as an ideology to oppose not only to the inherited privileges but also to the powerful wealthy class, most notably Zaibatsu (industrial and financial conglomerates).
sen.cmt: plutocracyとzaibatsuはほぼ同義語なので、経済的権力をthe powerful wealthy classとし、顕著なものとしてzaibatsu、という構成にしました。

sen.j: 昭和前期においては在野の知識層のみならず青年将校や革新官僚が一君万民論の支持勢力として登場した。
sen.e: In the early Showa period not only out-of-power intellectuals but also young officers and reformational government bureaucrat appeared as the supporters of Ikkunbanmin-ron.
In the early Showa period, the theory once again got supporters, including out-of-power intellectuals, young officers and reformist bureaucrats.
sen.cmt: 革新官僚。革新的主張を持つ持つ官僚 reformist bureaucratsとしました。
